summary: This is an email from a U.S. Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) staff member to Audrey Strauss, forwarding a draft letter to Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and a Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation. The email indicates the letter is subject to review and will likely be sent soon.

persons.name: Strauss, Audrey
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing a draft letter to Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and discovery from the SDFL investigation.

persons.name: John
persons.context: A colleague (likely in the U.S. Attorney's Office) who provided comments on the margins of the draft letter to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The federal judge to whom the draft letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and the SDFL investigation is addressed.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell, the subject of the draft letter to Judge Nathan regarding discovery from the SDFL investigation.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) collaborating on a legal document regarding the Maxwell case.
U.S. Attorney corresponding with the presiding judge on a case matter.
Judge presiding over the legal proceedings involving defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Draft Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: A draft letter is prepared for Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and discovery materials from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for the day after this email to discuss the draft letter regarding Maxwell and the SDFL investigation.

locations: U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York (presumed location of Judge Nathan)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was preparing correspondence for Judge Alison Nathan regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case in late September 2020.
The correspondence concerned discovery materials from a separate investigation conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (SDFL).
The draft letter was under internal review by attorneys 'John' and the sender, indicating ongoing case preparation and coordination.
The email confirms Judge Alison Nathan was the presiding judge in the Maxwell case at this time.
